Structs/OAuth2AuthConfig/UI.html#/s:6OAu.abstract: Starting with iOS 9, SFSafariViewController will be used for embedded authorization instead of our custom class. You can turn this off here.

Structs/OAuth2AuthConfig/UI.html#/contro.abstract: You can assign a UIColor here, which will be applied to Safari’s (in iOS 10.10+) or the legacy web view controller’s item tint colors (also see: barTintColor).

Structs/OAuth2AuthConfig/UI.html.name: UI
Structs/OAuth2AuthConfig/UI.html.abstract: Sub-stuct holding configuration relevant to UI presentation.

Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.name: useKeychain
Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.abstract: If set to true (the default) will use system keychain to store tokens. Use "keychain": bool in settings.

Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.name: keychainAccountForTokens
Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.abstract: The keychain account to use to store tokens. Defaults to currentTokens.

Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.name: keychainAccessMode
Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.abstract: Defaults to kSecAttrAccessibleWhenUnlocked. MUST be set via keychain_access_group init setting.

Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.name: keychainAccessGroup
Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.abstract: Keychain access group, none is set by default. MUST be set via keychain_access_group init setting.

Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.name: storableTokenItems()

Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.abstract: Stores our current token(s) in the keychain.

Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.name: forgetTokens()
Classes/OAuth2Securable.html#/s:6OAuth20.abstract: Unsets the tokens and deletes them from the keychain.

Classes/OAuth2Requestable.html#/s:6OAuth.name: verbose

Classes/OAuth2Requestable.html#/s:6OAuth.name: sessionConfiguration

Classes/OAuth2Base.html#/s:6OAuth20A4Bas.name: clientSecret

Classes/OAuth2AuthRequest.html#/s:6OAuth.abstract: The url of the receiver. Queries may by added by parameters specified on params.

Classes/OAuth2AuthRequest.html#/s:6OAuth.name: unset(header:)

Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.name: perform(request:retry:callback:)
Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.abstract: This method takes an additional retry flag, then uses the base implementation of perform(request:callback:) to perform the given

Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.name: attemptToAuthorize(callback:)
Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.abstract: If not already authorizing, will use its oauth2 instance to start authorization after forgetting any tokens (!).

Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.name: enqueue(request:callback:)
Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.abstract: Enqueues the given URLRequest and callback. You probably don’t want to use this method yourself.

Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.name: enqueue(request:)
Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.abstract: Enqueues the given OAuth2DataRequest. You probably don’t want to use this method yourself.

Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.name: dequeueAndApply(closure:)
Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.abstract: Dequeue all enqueued requests, applying the given closure to all of them. The queue will be empty by the time the closure is called.

Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.name: retryAll()
Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.abstract: Uses dequeueAndApply() by signing and re-performing all enqueued requests.

Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.name: throwAllAway(with:)
Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html#/s:6OAuth2.abstract: Uses dequeueAndApply() to all enqueued requests, calling their callback with a response representing the given error.

Classes/OAuth2DataLoader.html.abstract: A class that makes loading data from a protected endpoint easier.
